Andrew grabs his copy of the chart -- i called “CARAVAN” -- when-- FLETCHER (CONT’D) Neiman. Stay a bit, ok? Andrew nods. Carl, at the door, glares at him. Then slink FLETCHER (CONT’D) (approaching, pointing to the chart) Look at this. See the tempo?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Quarter note 330...

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: That's a double-time swing. That’s what got you in here, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I guess so... Fletcher grins. Then -- the smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Now, just as was the case with you, I stumbled on a kid practicing his double- time swing the other night. I’d like to give him a shot. Before Andrew can register, let alone ask “Who?”--

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Am I late? Fletcher and Andrew turn to the door. RYAN CONNOLLY is he

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Perfect timing! Join us, Connolly. (Ryan heads over, smiling) You two know each other, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yep, Nassau Band. ‘Sup, Andrew... Ryan is all smiles. But Andrew is mortified. Can barely conceal his anxiety -- and his anger.  Pink (9/10/2013) 57

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Now, Connolly, I’ve made Andrew a temporary core-- (Andrew’s eyes shoot up at the word “temporary” ) --but we've got the competition this weekend and I want to make sure the new chart’s in good shape. Ryan nods, reaches into his backpack. And, to Andrew's sh pulls out the “new chart”. CARAVAN.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: This one, right? Andrew's wide-eyed. When did he get the chart?

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: (as though he can read his mind) I gave it to him this morning, Neiman. Now, all I want to do is test out the part. Neiman, if you wouldn’t mind, could we take it from the top with just you? Andrew tries to keep calm. Goes to the drums, lays out th chart. FLETCHER (CONT’D) Don’t worry, I don’t care about hits. That’1l be tonight. For now, just tempo. Andrew nods. Takes a deep breath. Looks at the tempo nota “330”. Another breath. Ok... I've got this... Fletcher CL Andrew BEGINS. FLETCHER (CONT’D) No... That’s not quite my tempo...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I’m -- I’m sorry -- I’1ll--

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Let’s see if Connolly can do it, ok? Beat. Andrew looks at Ryan. Heart pounding, he switches w him. Fletcher CLAPS. Ryan BEGINS. And he plays perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Connolly -- that was excellent. See, this is the beauty of Studio Band. You come in an alternate -- but a minute later, you could be the new core. Andrew's eyes widen again.  53 Pink (9/10/2013) 58

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You're not serious. Fletcher looks at Andrew -- as though shocked Andrew talk back. A moment of silence. Then -- BZZZZZ. Fletcher's cel

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Connolly, the chart’s yours. See you both tonight at 9. (answering the phone) Hi, this is Terence... He heads to his OFFICE. Andrew is still. What just happen

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: How you been, bro? (Andrew looks at Ryan) I think it was the injury that kept me out last time. But I’m fuckin’ stoked to be joining you guys now. Andrew just stares. Ryan seems earnest -- but Andrew is i

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (mistaking Andrew's look for anxiety) Don’t worry about Fletch, either. My granddad knew his dad from the Philharmonic when Fletcher was trying to break in. He’s more bark than bite. Andrew's eyes really widen now: What the fuck is going on He gets up, marches to Fletcher’s door, and-- INT. GEHRING HALL - FLETCHER’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS 53 --BURSTS in. Fletcher’s just finished his call.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER ANDREW
dialogues.text: What are--? I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER ANDREW
dialogues.text: Now is not the time, I I can play that part, you swear to God-- know I can--

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: I_said NOT NOW!!! There’s more desperation in Fletcher’s voice than anger. Andrew notices something else: Fletcher’s eyes are wateri Andrew is silent. He’s never seen Fletcher like this.  54

dialogues.speaker: 54A
dialogues.text: 55 Pink (9/10/2013) 59 FLETCHER (CONT’D) (softly, as though close to crying) You want the part? Then...earn it. A moment passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew busts back through the STUDIO BAND ROOM. Eyes burn One thought and one thought only: Get that part back.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Bro! Wanna grab lunch? But Andrew doesn’t answer. Just keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew pours ice into a sink. Turns on the faucet. Dips a glass jug in and collects ice water. INT. ANDREW’S PRACTICE ROOM - DAY 55 Andrew practices the part... He’s pushing, giving it his “CARAVAN” on his stand, scribbled over with pencil markin “forte”, “triplets!", “hemiola 1-3", “don't slow down!"

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Come on... Come on... He stops. His hand throbbing from blisters. He dips it by side -- into the jug of ICE WATER. Clenches. Blood clouds water. He resumes playing -- frenzied, exhausted. Fucks up, scre

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck!!!! Starts pounding his stick against the drum-head. Then his Pounding harder and harder, once, twice, three times, fou times. Hand bleeding more, the drum-skin giving way, fina tearing and breaking. He STARTS PLAYING again, fed up, enraged, SHOUTING at him ANDREW (CONT’D) Come on you fucking piece of shit... Come on!!! COME ON! !!!  56 57 Pink (9/10/2013) 60

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded subway car. Andrew is seated, poring over his s music, running through the beats in his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLAYERS sit silently. Ryan on the drum throne, Carl a Andrew behind him -- Carl still humiliated, Andrew 100% focused. The clock reads: 9:00. Not a word in the room. Fletcher emerges. A CD PLAYER in his hand. He plugs it in

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Ok... Um... For the first time ever, he seems uneasy, unsure what to FLETCHER (CONT’D) We...we have a new player. Ryan Connolly. Ryan nods, waves to the other PLAYERS. Chipper--

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Sup, dudes. Andrew glares at him. Seething now. But, continuing, soft

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: But I...if you could just...put your instruments down... Just for a second... He turns to the CD player. Turns it on. A big-band ballad swells. A muted trumpet takes the lead. It’s CASEY’S SONG and it’s a tender sound, full of melancholy... For a few seconds, Fletcher doesn’t say a word. His thoug seem to be drifting. Then, hesitant, as the music plays.. FLETCHER (CONT’D) Six years ago...I saw a kid practicing scales in a band room here. He'd started at Shaffer with a lot of hope, but the truth was he’d barely squeaked in and he was struggling. Everyone on the faculty told him: “This isn’t for you.” But they didn’t see what I saw... (his voice croaking again, emotional, ) ...this...this scared, skinny kid cursing himself ‘cause he couldn’t get his scales right... I saw a drive in him... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pink (9/10/2013) 61 FLETCHER (CONT’D) And I put him in Studio Band, and we worked together for three years, and when he graduated, Marsalis made him third trumpet at Lincoln Center. A year later, he was first. That’s who you’re hearing now. (then, ) His name was Sean Casey. The name catches Andrew’s attention. The trumpeter Fletch mentioned to him... And the word “was”... FLETCHER (CONT’D) I found out this morning...that Sean died. He died in a car accident yesterday... (takes a moment, is having trouble speaking) I just wanted you guys to know that... He was... Sean was a... (and, almost dissolving into tears on these next words) -.-beautiful player... (breathes in, collects himself) I just thought you all should know. Beat. He leans back down and turns off the CD. Silence. FLETCHER (CONT’D) (another moment; then, still shaky--) “Caravan”. From bar 142, please. The PLAYERS open their folders, pick up their instruments Fletcher waits. Hesitates again... Then -- CLAPS. Just dr bass and trombone play the trombone solo section of CARAV STUDIO BAND REHEARSAL. Fast, precise -- but Fletcher wave Ryan to stop.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, that’s...that’s not quite right, Connolly... Sorry... Andrew's eyes instantly fill with hope. Is this his chanc

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I... I want to try Neiman on this... Ok? Ryan nods, slowly slides off -- as Andrew quickly gets on Clutches his sticks tight. This is it... Fletcher’s still FLETCHER (CONT’D) Maybe...maybe now’s the time for Neiman to earn the part... Beat. He CLAPS off, Andrew starts, and, only ONE SECOND l  Pink (9/10/2013) 62

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, I guess not. Tanner. An anger is creeping into Fletcher's voice now. The stammering fading away, bit by bit. Dismayed, Andrew gets off, Carl gets on, Fletcher CLAPS him off -- and then, SLAMMING his fist down on his table, the barely suppresse grief giving way now to terrifying, full-out rage--

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mother-FUCKER! ! ! Carl JUMPS. The band goes silent. Fletcher glares at his drummers, eyes so heated they could burn holes into you.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get your ass back on the kit, Connolly. Ryan does. The other players are still. Real fear in the FLETCHER (CONT’D) I will find my tempo out of one of you faggots if it takes me all goddamned night. His tone is vicious, his eyes still watery. He CLAPS, sto

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Which it just might. Neiman. Andrew gets on. His hands are shaking. Fletcher CLAPS, st FLETCHER (CONT’D) Not my tempo. Switch. Carl gets back on. Fletcher CLAPS, stops yet again-- FLETCHER (CONT’D) Not my FUCKING tempo! !!! He turns to the rest of the band. Rubs his eyes, breathes then, trying to keep calm but his face already beet-red.. FLETCHER (CONT’D) Ok... Sorry about this, gang, hate to put you through it. But rest your arms, put aside your instruments, if you need to take a dump do it now, ‘cause I am going to go for as long as it takes until I find a drummer who can play in time. (to the drummers--) You hear me talking, cocksuckers? You'd better start shitting me perfect 400’s. Connolly. You first. Get on the kit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLAYERS mull through the hall, stretching. A few yawns. Y tell these guys have been here for hours already... And t the wall, the kind of screaming that shakes you to your c

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Motherfucking COCKSUCKER!!! Is--

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: --that the fastest you can go?? It is no fucking wonder Mommy ran out on you, you worthless acne-scarred fetal-position Hymie fuck. GET OFF!!! Andrew -- whole body shaking, had been playing for half a hour straight -- gets off the kit, struggling for breath, hands coated with torn blisters and blood. Fletcher's rag unlike anything we’ve seen from him: pained, vengeful... Carl gets on the kit. Fletcher CLAPS. The clock: 11:06. FLETCHER (CONT’D) Well what do we have here? Gay Pride himself. This is not a Sinead O’Connor concert, Tanner. I am sorry to inform you we will not be serving Baked Alaska and Cosmopolitans tonight. Now why don’t you try playing faster than you give fucking hand jobs?? One! One! One! One! OFF THE

dialogues.speaker: FUCKING KIT
dialogues.text: Carl stops. Staggers back, dazed, as Ryan moves up and be

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now we got ourselves our mick fucking paddy- cracker. Did you know you look like a fucking leprechaun? I think I’1l call you Flannery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLAYERS rinse their faces. One looks at his watch, dead-t It’s very late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some players have now returned to their seats.  Pink (9/10/2013) 64

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Switch! Carl stops playing. Almost falls as he gets off the kit. takes his place -- just as worn out. As soon as he sits d at the set he has to bend down to catch his breath. FLETCHER (CONT’D) It is not Saint fucking Patrick’s Day, Flannery, there is not a pot of gold under your fucking seat. Play. Fletcher CLAPS. Ryan plays, muscles cramping, can’t keep

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Switch! Ryan stops, gasping. Fletcher’s eyes land... ...ON ANDREW. Face awash in sweat, hair dripping, muscles throbbing, wrists red, hands caked in blood, T-shirt clin to his chest. This is it...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: muttering to himself as he ttering to himself h gets on the kit) Come on... Come on you fuck...

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Let’s see if we can finally bring this home. He CLAPS. Andrew begins. FLETCHER (CONT’D) Don’t slow down. Andrew tries, the tempo slips... So fast, so loud...

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Speed up! God-fucking-damnit I said SPEED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew's arms are moving as fast as they possibly can, hi feet like triggers -- and his ears start RINGING now, the RINGING cutting and almost drowning out the other sounds. Fletcher, fire-eyed, turns around and goes into the neare CLOSET. Emerges with a COWBELL and a STICK. Comes closer BANGS ON IT in time. The SOUND slices through the RINGING startles Andrew, this stick whacking down inches from his

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't stop!!  62 Pink (9/10/2013) 65 Andrew doesn't stop. Manages to glare forward, with what almost seems like hatred in his tired, blood-shot eyes... FLETCHER (CONT’D) Faster!... Faster! ! (Andrew speeds up) Do it! Do it! Do it! Do it! Do it! Do it! One! One! One! One! One! One! One! One!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew slips, almost loses the beat. Fletcher GRABS the F TOM DRUM and HURLS it through the air, against the neares wall. It RAMS into the concrete, handles buckling. But An stays focused. Doesn’t cry.

dialogues.speaker: KEEP PLAYING
dialogues.text: Andrew does. Fletcher raises the COWBELL now, about to ST Andrew across the head, looks like a fucking madman -- bu still Andrew does not cry -- as Fletcher BELLOWS--

dialogues.speaker: KEEP PLAYING
dialogues.text: Andrew keeps playing. Fletcher stands still. Stares at him. Circles the drum se like a predatory beast, ready to strike at any instant. Then -- he steps back. Drops the cowbell and stick. Andre still playing, going like an automaton. No tears. Finally Fletcher silently raises his hand, and, with just a sligh wave, gestures for Andrew to stop. Andrew does. Nearly collapses over the set. FLETCHER (CONT’D) Congratulations, Neiman. You earned the part. He turns to the rest of the band. FLETCHER (CONT’D) Ok. Now we can begin. The clock: 2:00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s 3:30am. The PLAYERS stagger out of the building. Zom Andrew appears, red-eyed, past exhaustion. Fletcher emerg  63 64 Pink (9/10/2013) 66

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: 5pm call tomorrow. Leave at least two hours from New York this time. Save your travel receipts. Or don’t, I don’t give a fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He then walks off. Andrew watches him leave. And, as we z on Andrew's eyes... ...we see that something fundamental has changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks like a completely different person now. 100% hol out.

dialogues.speaker: BUS DRIVER, (PRE-LAP)
dialogues.text: Next stop Dunellen. Two hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on a Greyhound, packed. Another VOICE in the back..

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Bop-ba-d-d-da-bop... Bada-bop-bop-bop...  65 66 67 Pink (9/10/2013) 67 It's Andrew. Hunched over sheet music, earphones on, coun aloud through “CARAVAN”. And, by his side -- a Zip-lock b PILLS. Just like the ones we saw exchanged at the party o his dorm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PASSENGERS look at him. Who is this lunatic...?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bop-bada-bop... Ba-da-bop-ba-d-d-d-da-bop... And suddenly -- A JOLT. The bus ROCKS to the side, lights out, the wheels SCREECH to an abrupt stop. Andrew removes earphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The side of the road. Andrew and the other PASSENGERS sta outside, waiting, the BUS’s right tire blown, a rod lodge into its side. Andrew checks his phone for the time. Fuck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nondescript Jersey town. A NEW BUS comes to a stop, set down passengers on Dunellen’s Main Street. Andrew bolts o carrying his stick bag and music folder. Looks around. Perplexed. Grabs a PASSERBY--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW PASSERBY
dialogues.text: Do you know where all the No, you gotta call the cabs are? They said there cabs. Takes half an hour were cabs here, that’s what notice.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW PASSERBY
dialogues.text: What? Well is there a -- They got a car rental down another bus or-- on Pine.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Which way?? The Passerby points -- and Andrew starts RUNNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five blocks later -- Andrew dashes across a patch of gras reaches a door, grabs the handle. The door won’t open. He white. Sees the HOURS sign. Eyes scroll down. Starts POUN  Pink (9/10/2013) 68

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You’re still open! You’re still open! A MAN appears. Gestures for Andrew to calm down. Opens up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew finishes signing paperwork. Grabs his MUSIC FOLDER BACKPACK from the nearest chair, hurries off. WE DRIFT ba ...to the STICK BAG left on the chair.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. CAR RENTAL AGENCY
dialogues.text: Andrew RUNS like mad across a small LOT. Reaches a CAR, o up and jumps in. Plugs an address into the GPS. The estim time: 9 minutes. The clock: 3:02... He floors it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew drives fast. His cell rings--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Hello??

dialogues.speaker: PIANIST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Neiman, where the fuck are you? Call-time was 5.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I’m sorry -- I’m on my way. I’m almost--

dialogues.speaker: PIANIST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We're on stage in twenty-- I know, I’m almost ther--

dialogues.speaker: PIANIST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: --and Fletcher's got Connolly warming up in case you don't show.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: God-fucking-damnit, I SAID I was on my way, you tell the redhead I’m ON MY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws the phone against his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew pulls up.  70 Pink (9/10/2013) 69

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew arrives, panting. Fletcher glares, the band behind

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Glad you could work us into your schedule, darling.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I’m here. I’m ready to play.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Too late. Connolly’s playing. Andrew looks over to his left -- to Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Like fucking hell he is. Fletcher looks at him. Stunned. The PLAYERS also look sho

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: It’s my part.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Actually it’s my part. I decide who I lend it to.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I have the folder--

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: I see the folder for a change, but I don’t see the sticks. Andrew is about to counter -- when he looks down. Looks b Thinks. Realizes... Skin paling, his heart racing...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: They’re -- they’re in the car, I just have to grab them--

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Nope. I’m warming the band up now.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I’1l use Ryan’s sticks.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: You lost the part, Neiman.  Pink (9/10/2013) 70

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No I didn’t!! You can’t do this!

dialogues.speaker: I CAN/T
dialogues.text: He marches toward Andrew. Looms over him, seems about to FLETCHER (CONT’D) When did you become an authority on what I can or cannot do you weepy-willow shitsack?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: When I earned that part.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Earned? You've never earned a thing. The only reason you're a fucking core is because you misplaced a folder. The only reason you’re in Studio Band is because I told you what I’d be asking for in Nassau.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Bullshit. I’m in Studio Band because--

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Why don’t you back off, bro?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Johnny Utah. Turn my pages.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: You realize I can cut you anytime I feel.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You would’ve cut me by now.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Try me you weasel. At 5:30, that’s in eleven minutes, my band is on-stage. You're not there with your own sticks, or you show up and make a single mistake -- a single one -- and I’1l send you back to Nassau Band to turn pages until you graduate or drop out. For extra kicks, I'll spread the word on just how you became a Studio Band core, and by the time my sewing circle is done you'll make your dad look like a success story. (lets that linger, then, ) Or I can give “Johnny Utah” the part and we'll leave it at that. Your choice.

dialogues.speaker: 71A
dialogues.text: 72 Pink (9/10/2013) 71 Beat. Andrew catches sight of Carl, standing in the back, watching -- and almost smiling. He turns back to Fletcher

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: It’s my part. I'll be on the stage.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: That’s 10 minutes 50 seconds left, you pathetic pansy-ass fruit-fuck. Andrew turns. Bumps into Ryan, PUSHES him out of the way,

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. DUNELLEN AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: Andrew drives away. The clock changes from 5:20 to 5:21.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. CAR RENTAL AGENCY
dialogues.text: Andrew pulls up at the rental agency. The clock changes f 5:27 to 5:28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew races into the rental agency. They’re still open.. the STICK BAG...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew runs to his car and peels off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew on the road, speeding like a demon, the GPS on. Lo the clock. 5:30. Then 5:31. Whips out his cell. Dials...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: It's Neiman... Tell Fletcher I’m coming.

dialogues.speaker: PIANIST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the fuck is taking so long?? They're moving on-stage now.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: There was -- there was a problem with the lock on my car. It’s solved and I’m coming.

dialogues.speaker: GPS VOICE
dialogues.text: Left turn up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pink (9/10/2013) 72 Andrew looks at the GPS. Fuck. Tries to switch it off.

dialogues.speaker: PIANIST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you driving?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No.. The GPS BEEPS for the turn.

dialogues.speaker: PIANIST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Tell Fletcher I’m coming or I'll rip out your fucking eyes. He hangs up. Enraged. Slams down on the gas, engine roari PICKING UP SPEED... The GPS says “2 minutes” left... The turns 5:32... The speedometer SHOOTING UP... UP... UP... The car reaching a STOP SIGN...but Andrew keeps going, no looking... His car SPEEDING UP and SPEEDING UP until it’s-- --SLAMMED INTO. Glass flying everywhere, everything going so fast, as tho the vehicle had just been whipped up by a tornado...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car FLIPS, 180, the top crunching down like paper, An spun around and shoved up against it -- bleeding, battere

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. DUNELLEN STREET
dialogues.text: --until the car comes to a stop, upside down. Glass and b Silence. Andrew takes a moment to understand what has just happene Gasping for breath, he yanks himself up -- but finds his HAND is caught under the steering wheel. He yanks, pulls it. It won’t budge. Smoke and exhaust fumes billow up... He tugs and tugs and pulls and -- finally -- CRAAAACK -- bone of his index finger SNAPS. The most painful sound yo imagine. He SCREAMS in agony. YANKS back, staggering...  73 Pink (9/10/2013) 73 His hand is free. Bone broken, bleeding profusely. Andrew crawls out of the car... Rises to his feet... Dizz world spinning... The TRUCK DRIVER who rammed into him is over--

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Are you ok???

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I -- I need -- I -- my -- my sticks... He turns back to the car. Bends down to reach back in...

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: No -- stay away from the car, it’s not sa-- Andrew blocks him out. Reaches with his right hand -- the working one -- and goes for the STICK BAG, sandwiched bet the caved-in top and the seat. Groaning in pain as he reaches... Gets it. TRUCK DRIVER (CONT’D) I’m calling 9-1-1, you’re going to be ok--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I -- I have to -- I have to go, it’s -- it’s three more blocks--

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: (holding him back) Sir, you don’t have to go anywhere--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Get your hands off me!!! He yanks free from the Driver’s grasp and starts RUNNING.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. DUNELLEN AUDITORIUM
dialogues.text: Still running, has been running for three blocks... Out o breath, even dizzier than before... Reaches the front gre face coated in sweat, and hand drenched in blood... Almos collapses... A couple of PASSERSBY see him, shocked--

dialogues.speaker: PASSERBY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... --but he either doesn’t notice or doesn’t care. He’s dead tunnel vision, only cares about the goal: Get on-stage... Andrew busts inside. Eyes scanning. Hears the sound of TU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dashes in from backstage. The PLAYERS have taken their pl finished tuning, are about to perform. Andrew sees Fletch Fletcher sees him. Hiding his arm behind his stick bag--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I’m here. I’m here. I’m here. Doesn't even wait for Fletcher’s answer, goes straight to set where Ryan is seated. Nothing is going to stop him no

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get off. Get off the fucking set. Ryan looks at Fletcher. Fletcher waits -- then nods, almo smiling. Seems he’s having fun with this. Ryan slides off pissed, and takes a seat next to Carl. Andrew takes his p His left hand still hidden, Andrew props up his music and pulls out a pair of sticks. Tries to hold his left stick properly -- but it keeps giving way. With his index finge broken, it’s impossible to keep the stick steady... He looks at the music: “Caravan”... Looks back at his han Tries to move his left fingers, mimicking the stick patte Just up ahead -- Fletcher. Animal intensity... Andrew closes his eyes... Tries to block out the anxiety. The pain... The stress that just keeps mounting and mount Gropes inside his STICK BAG. Pulls out his bag of pills. it. Pills scatter. Picks a pill up, pops it, out of sight

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCEMENT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Shaffer Conservatory Studio Band... Fletcher raises his hand, ready to cue... Andrew tries to his breathing under control... Ryan and Carl lean forward Ryan catches a glimpse of Andrew’s left hand, just as... ...Fletcher’s finger MOVES. THE BAND IS OFF. It explodes into CARAVAN DUNELLEN at lig speed. But Andrew is already in trouble... Blood getting on the snare... Ears starting to RING... Left hand barely keepin up... The whole thing slowly slipping away from him... He closes his eyes. Mouths: “Come on come on come on..."  Pink (9/10/2013) 15 A big FILL coming up. He needs both his hands. Launches i it -- and his left stick CATCHES the edge of a stand... ..-AND GOES FLYING. Falling and sliding under the hi-hat

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: (still riding with his right hand) Stick... Carl stays still. Andrew looks at him. But Carl won’t mov Panicked, Andrew turns, eyes his old Nassau Band peer --

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ryan... Stick... Ryan hesitates. Doesn’t want to think of himself as a saboteur. But he looks at Carl, Carl looks back at him... right then and there he makes his choice.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please... Neither Carl nor Ryan moves. Andrew, thinking fast, eyes the fallen stick. Trying as h he can to keep that tempo going with his right hand, he s down the left side of his body, stretching his arm as far can go... His broken finger grazing the stick... Grabbing Pulls up -- and -- another CRAAAAAACK as his finger is ca against the hi-hat pedal and the bone is bent 90 degrees. GASPS, almost cries out in pain. Has to hold it in. Pulls himself back up to the set -- and there, looming ov already, is Fletcher. Eyes fiery--

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: The fuck are you doing...??? Andrew keeps playing. But the PAIN is harder and harder t ignore. His snare drum completely smeared in red now, his stick stained, his whole arm shaking. And that RINGING -- growing and growing, drowning out everything else... He looks at the SHEET MUSIC, suddenly lost... The horns b out a hit -- but Andrew isn’t on it. Fuck. Launches into fill -- and hits the crash at the wrong time. Fletcher stares at him. The look says it all: it’s over. Andrew keeps fighting. Another missed hit, then a missed signature change, the beat falling apart beneath his feet chaos, and then, finally, the sign of death -- Andrew STO  75 76 78 Pink (9/10/2013) 716 Almost immediately, the rest of the band grinds to a halt a horrible sound, like a car screeching, nails on a chalk Fletcher stands in place, eyes on Andrew. In fact, all ey on Andrew. The theater is dead-silent. Disbelief everywhe Calmly, Fletcher approaches Andrew and whispers one last FLETCHER (CONT’D) You're done. Then he turns around. Andrew start shaking, his eyes brim -- and, suddenly, something takes over inside. Almost des himself, he RISES -- and KICKS OVER THE DRUMS. Cymbals CRASH to the wooden stage-floor like bombs. Andre CHARGES forward -- and, just as Fletcher turns to him, TA the man to the ground... Andrew goes absolutely batshit crazy on Fletcher, murder eyes... Raises his fists, about to POUND into Fletcher's when SECURITY GUARDS yank him off, pulling him away in a Torn from his target, Andrew breaks down into TEARS. Ever thing inside him spilling out like water. Fletcher, stunn uninjured, gets back on his feet. His shirt drips with bl not his own, but Andrew’s. A SECURITY GUARD rushes onto t scene, and Andrew, kicking and screaming, is DRAGGED OFF. We linger inside the theater. A hush over the audience, t players and their instruments. And then, a card: Final Competition of the Winter Season

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 76
dialogues.text: INT. ANDREW’S DORMITORY - DAY 78 Andrew stands alone in his dorm. Staring into space. A bandage on his hand. Time has passed... Lets his eyes take in one item at a time: A drum pad on t floor. A metronome. A DISMISSAL LETTER... He’s been expel from Shaffer. A DVD. He slides that into his laptop, sits down slowly..  83 84 Pink (9/10/2013) 716A A HOME VIDEO begins: a smiling EIGHT-YEAR-OLD BOY at a DRUM... It’s ANDREW... Innocent, bright-eyed, having a blast...

dialogues.speaker: EIGHT-YEAR-OLD ANDREW
dialogues.text: .---and this is my pa-ra-did-dle... He plays a paradiddle on the drum: left-right-left-left. A CHEER off-camera, a voice we recognize -- his father,

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Woooo-hoooo! !! EIGHT-YEAR-OLD ANDREW glows. And our Andrew, hurting, tearing up, watches... Pulls the DVD out. SNAPS it in half. Tosses the halves in the trash. Slides the drum pad and metronome into the trash as well. Ties the trash bag and pulls it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew busts in, starts breaking his drums down. First the cymbals come off, then the pedals, then the toms... A look of resolution on his face -- and, bubbling up, anger... He tears at the drums as though attacking them, pulls them apart almost viciously, one part after another Then the Buddy Rich POSTER -- which he rips to shreds... INT. HALLWAY - ANDREW’S PRACTICE ROOM - MOMENTS LATER 84 Andrew THROWS trash bags into a garbage can... Heads back and eyes his PRACTICE ROOM -- now empty. He takes a momen Sits down on the hallway floor, the drum parts stacked to the side. Leans back, closes his eyes, and takes a deep breath out... It’s done. He pulls out his cell. A beat. Then--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Ok... Where do you want me to meet you?  77

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RACHEL BORNHOLDT -- lawyer, elegantly dressed -- sits acr from Andrew, Jim to the side. There’s a glass of white wi Jim, a club soda for Rachel, and an untouched water for A A moment of silence. Finally--

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL BORNHOLDT
dialogues.text: Andrew...? Andrew remains silent for a moment. Then--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: When did you contact my dad?  Pink (9/10/2013) 78

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: They just called me this week, Andr--

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL BORNHOLDT
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Does the name Sean Casey mean anything to you? Andrew looks back at Rachel. A moment. Warily, he nods. RACHEL BORNHOLDT (CONT’D) So you know of his death? Last month he hung himself in his apartment. Andrew takes this in. Fletcher had said it was a car acci

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with me?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL BORNHOLDT
dialogues.text: Sean suffered from anxiety and depression. His mother claims this started during his time as Fletcher’s student. Andrew looks at her. Rachel can tell he’s surprised. A moment passes. RACHEL BORNHOLDT (CONT’D) Now, the Caseys aren’t wealthy. They don’t want to file suit.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Then what do they want?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL BORNHOLDT
dialogues.text: To make sure Terence Fletcher is never allowed to do this to another student.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: He didn’t do anything.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL BORNHOLDT
dialogues.text: So President Kohn and Dean Pence will tell you. To them, Fletcher is Shaffer. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL BORNHOLDT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But if they think we have a case like this and can win in court, they’1ll have no choice but to let him go before we do. Beat. Andrew looks at her. Then at his dad.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Well, I have nothing to say. Jim leans forward now, taking the initiative--

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Andrew... It’s over, ok...? He’s out of your life. Why let him get away with what he did to you? He eyes Rachel. Ok...? Was that the right thing to say... Andrew stays silent.

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL BORNHOLDT
dialogues.text: Would you characterize his conduct as extreme, Andrew? Did he ever intentionally inflict emotional distress? Still Andrew doesn’t respond. Feels his dad’s stare on him as well now. RACHEL BORNHOLDT (CONT’D) (trying to persuade--) This would not be a public hearing, you know... Fletcher would never know it was you who spoke up. Andrew looks at the glass of water in front of him. Untou

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: ...-What would happen to him?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL BORNHOLDT
dialogues.text: Shaffer will do anything to prevent this from going to court. Yours won’t be the first complaint, but I think it’1l tip the balance. You’re recent.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: You tried other students?

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL BORNHOLDT
dialogues.text: Some -- but you guys are walls.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: And you thought I'd talk.  Pink (9/10/2013) 79

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL BORNHOLDT
dialogues.text: You have nothing to gain from Fletcher anymore. A beat. Andrew turns his eyes to his dad. Anger in his ga

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Why did you do this...? Jim seems taken aback. Flustered for a second. Then--

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: You think I was going to let him put my son through hell and walk off scot-free? Andrew turns away. Jim can see the hurt on his son’s face The sense of betrayal. Worried, trying to reach out--

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you know I would never let that happen, Andrew? That there’s nothing in the world more important to me than you? (beat; Andrew evades his gaze) Don’t you know that? A moment. Andrew looks at his dad again. Then he stares ahead. WE PUSH in on him, slowly -- as he drifts deeper into thought, trying to sort through it all...

dialogues.speaker: RACHEL BORNHOLDT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...Andrew? Andrew can barely hear her... Defeated, his soul split in two... Finally -- he gives up

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Just tell me what to say. WE FADE OUT.  79 80 81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Summer in New York. Tube tops, street performers, sunshin Andrew, hand healed, carries laundry. Looks up and sees a sign: “BACK IN NYC! JVC JAZZ FESTIVAL June 21-29”. We’re Lower East Side -- far, far away from Shaffer... INT. ANDREW’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - LATE AFTERNOON 87 A new apartment. Andrew's dad is already inside, sliding groceries into the fridge when Andrew enters.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy. You ready? INT. ANDREW’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - LATE AFTERNOON 88 Blinds closed, as Andrew and Jim sit and watch “North by Northwest” on TV. We PAN from a few college applications table, past the walls -- no decorations at all -- to Andr Jim seated. We linger on Andrew's face. There’s a sadness in his eyes looks tired, even after months, and resigned.  89 90 91 92 Pink (9/10/2013) 83 Jim laughs at a line in the movie. Glances over at his so wants to see if he’s enjoying himself. Hands him some pop A beat. INT. ANDREW’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - EVENING 89 Father and son stand by the doorway, Jim about to exit--

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: “Dr. No” next week. Or whatever’s playing on 86th...?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: -..I’d rather do it here.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Ok. I stacked your pantry with Gushers. Andrew manages a smile. A moment passes between them.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Thanks, Dad... Jim exits. Andrew hangs back. A moment... Then, Andrew glances down at his phone. Scrolls to a spec number: “NICOLE”. He looks at it. Thinking. Finger hovering over it... Then, too scared, he pulls back. Pockets the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew makes a ham sandwich, employee’s apron on. Hands i silently to a CUSTOMER. INT. JIM’S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY 91 Uncle Frank, Jim, and Travis sit on the couch watching a hockey game on TV. They laugh and cheer, as Andrew sits o the side, also watching -- his mind far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew walks alone, eating a slice of pizza. Crosses by a STREET PERFORMER -- a man drumming away on a row of bucke Doesn't watch, just keeps walking.  93

dialogues.speaker: 93A
dialogues.text: Pink (9/10/2013) 84 We follow, as Andrew passes a JAZZ CLUB on the next block Suddenly -- he stops. There, on the club’s main sign, below the featured names, these words: “Guest Performer: TERENCE FLETCHER”. Andrew put for a second. Completely taken aback. Then he starts walking away. Then stops. Nope. Turns around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -.-and steps inside. It’s a genteel venue. On the stage, DRUMS, BONGOS -- and, at the piano, FLETCHER. The mere sight gets Andrew’s pulse racing. But he stays p Watches... The quartet is pacing its way through FLETCHER SONG IN CLUB, and Fletcher is playing the final head. He' exceedingly delicate, gentle with each keystroke, his fin moving like ballerinas. His playing is soft, subtle, and exquisite. He plays the melody as though moved by it. Andrew is surprised by this... Stays in the back, behind last table. The song comes to a close. Fletcher smiles, l and then freezes. His eyes locked on Andrew. He has seen Andrew blanches, takes a step back, hurries for the exit. there's a PERSON blocking the way. Tries to squeeze throu

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That was Terence Fletcher, on the keys... More applause. Andrew, hemmed in, keeps trying to get out

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Neiman. Andrew stops. Turns. Fletcher is standing right there. A of silence. Andrew is pale. But Fletcher's face is a blan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A table in the corner. Fletcher and Andrew seated. They s have been sitting here in silence for some time. Two drin stand between them. Untouched. The other band members on- play JAZZ CLUB BLUES, a new PIANIST on the keys and a SAXOPHONIST added as well. Finally--  Pink (9/10/2013) 85

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: So what are you up to these days, Andrew?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: --.Oh, just...you know...various...things... Fletcher nods. Ok. Andrew eyes him. Then, nervous--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .-..I--I’m sorry about what happened. (then, should I clarify?--) At Dunellen.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t be. A player’s got to be willing to fight. Andrew looks at him. FLETCHER (CONT’D) You played with a broken bone. After crashing a car. That’s insane.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I was in a different place.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Good thing you’re not in that place anymore. A beat. Then -- Fletcher seems distracted. By people CLAP ALONG to the band... FLETCHER (CONT’D) Have you ever noticed it’s never the people with rhythm who clap along? He starts CLAPPING loudly, in the proper tempo. Leans ove the table next to his, where a COUPLE is clapping off-bea starts CLAPPING in their faces. Then sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know if you know... I don’t teach anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I... I heard about that... You quit?

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: -..No, not exactly. He looks at Andrew. A moment of tension. Does he know...?  Pink (9/10/2013) 86 FLETCHER (CONT’D) A couple parents got a kid from Sean Casey's year... I don’t know who, I think maybe a bassist... They got him to say a few things about me... That much I know... (Andrew tries to hide his relief) Though why anyone would have anything but honey and sugar to say about me is a mystery. Andrew laughs. Seems the mood has lightened. FLETCHER (CONT’D) That’s a good laugh, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Oh, no... I...I just--

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: No, it’s ok -- I know I’ve made some enemies. Maybe I seem to think my style is normal, but believe me, I don’t. A moment. Fletcher finally takes a sip of his drink. FLETCHER (CONT’D) I’m conducting some, though. They’re bringing back the JVC Fest this year, got me opening with a pro band in two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: (genuinely impressed) That’s amazing.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: (earns) It’s ok... Then, looking off for a moment-- FLETCHER (CONT’D) The truth is I don’t think people understand what it is I did at Shaffer. I wasn’t there to conduct. Any idiot can move his hands and keep people in tempo. No, it’s about pushing people beyond what's expected of them. And I believe that is a necessity. Because without it you’re depriving the world of its next Armstrong. Its next Parker. (pause) Why did Charlie Parker become Charlie Parker, Andrew?  Pink (9/10/2013) 87 Beat. Andrew is surprised. He’s told this story himself.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Because Jo Jones threw a cymbal at him.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Exactly. Young kid, pretty good on the sax, goes up to play his solo ina cutting session, fucks up -- and Jones comes this close to slicing his head off for it. He’s laughed off-stage. Cries himself to sleep that night. But the next morning, what does he do? He practices. And practices and practices. With one goal in mind: that he never ever be laughed off-stage again. A year later he goes back to the Reno, and he plays the best motherfucking solo the world had ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew smiles. Nods. Finally -- unlike his uncles, his co even his father -- someone who gets it. FLETCHER (CONT’D) Now imagine if Jones had just patted young Charlie on the head and said “Good job.” Charlie would've said to himself, “Well, shit, I did do a good job,” and that'd be that. No Bird. Tragedy, right? Except that’s just what people today want. The Shaffer Conservatories of the world, they want sugar. You don’t even say “cutting session” anymore, do you? No, you say “jam session”. What the fuck kind of word is that? Jam session? It’s a cutting session, Andrew, this isn’t fucking Smucker’s. It’s about weeding out the best from the worst so that the worst become better than the best. (beat) I mean look around you. $25 drinks, mood lighting, a little shrimp cocktail to go with your Coltrane. And people wonder why jazz is dying. (then, ) Take it from me, and every Starbucks jazz album only proves my point. There are no two words more harmful in the entire English language than “good job”. Beat. He leans back. Lets his words linger. Andrew thinks  Pink (9/10/2013) 88

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: But do you think there’s a line? You know -- where you discourage the next Charlie Parker from becoming Charlie Parker?

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: No. Because the next Charlie Parker would never be discouraged. Andrew takes this in. A moment...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: ..-And you? Are you back to playing now?

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Not really. Here and there... The playing never interested me. I never wanted to be Charlie Parker. I wanted to be the man who made Charlie Parker. The man who discovered some scrawny kid, pushed him, prodded him, shaped him into something great -- and then said to the world, “Check this out. The best motherfucking solo you've ever heard.”

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Who’s your Charlie Parker, then? (hesitant) Sean Casey...? The name hits Fletcher. Fletcher looks at Andrew -- who immediately regrets bringing that name up. Why? Because, after everything, the sight of Fletcher hurting affects h He pauses.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Sean... Sean was a sweet kid... And with all those idiots saying “This isn’t for you”, Sean did something great. Very few people ever get that chance... Looks off. Looks at the musicians on-stage... FLETCHER (CONT’D) But no... Not Sean Casey. (then, as he thinks about this, ) The truth is I don’t know if I ever had a Charlie Parker... (and then, ) But I tried. And that’s more than most people can say, Andrew. I tried. And even if I never find one, I will never apologize for trying.  94 Pink (9/10/2013) 89 He’s silent. A look of disappointment. Then, he points to the PIANIST on-stage... FLETCHER (CONT’D) He’s a beautiful player, isn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Yeah... Fletcher nods. His thoughts drifting again. A moment pass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew and Fletcher exit. They stand for a second. Look a one another. An awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Nice seeing you... Fletcher nods. Beat. Andrew turns, about to head off, whe

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Look. I don’t know how you’1l take this. That band I’m leading for JVC -- our drummer isn’t cutting it. (Andrew looks at him blankly...) Do you understand...?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: I’m using the Studio Band playlist. “Whiplash”, “Caravan”. I need a replacement who already knows those charts inside out. Andrew looks at him. You can’t be serious...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: (trying to gather his thoughts) Wh-- what -- what about Ryan Connolly...?

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: What about him? All he was was your incentive.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: ...And...and Tanner??  95

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: He switched to pre-med. (and with a hint of a smile) I think he got discouraged. Andrew is speechless now. Is this really happening? FLETCHER (CONT’D) We're rehearsing next Tuesday. Why don’t you take the weekend to think about it? Andrew takes it all in. WE PUSH in on him, processing... slowly but surely, his shock and uncertainty harden befor eyes -- into resolution... This is something to seize on.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I don’t need to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK -- then light floods in. Andrew has just opened his closet doors. In a stack, gathering dust, are his OLD DRU Andrew looks at them -- heart swelling, nerves racing... cur TO: INT. ANDREW’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER 95A Andrew setting the DRUMS up... Newly energized, a speed in his movements we haven’t seen since Dunellen... cur TO: INT. ANDREW’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - EVENING 95B Andrew practicing. You can tell he’s been here for hours already. Sweat runs in rivulets down his cheeks, wetting drum heads. His eyes are wide, glowing, focused... He's back to the life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty theater. It’s one of Carnegie Hall’s theaters -- bigger and far sleeker than any of the theaters Studio Ba played. Ceiling decked with lights, capacity 1200. On the stage, rehearsing, is a JAZZ ORCHESTRA. Similar set-up to Studio Band, the PLAYERS all young pros except, of course, Andrew, the youngest of all.  97 98 Pink (9/10/2013) 91 The chart is WHIPLASH JVC REHEARSAL, and the band sounds The players reach the end -- and Fletcher looks at his wa Composed, even mild.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Rest up, gang. Call-time Sunday is 6. (and, as he heads off, ) Andrew. (Andrew turns) Good job. Andrew takes this in. The latest in a long line of surprises... The PLAYERS pack up. Andrew, trying to work past his shyness--—

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Hope that was ok.

dialogues.speaker: BASSIST
dialogues.text: Yeah. You sounded good.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Thanks. You too. (then, ) Is there...anything you worked out with the previous guy that I should know?

dialogues.speaker: BASSIST
dialogues.text: Previous guy?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: The previous drummer. The BASSIST looks at him: What?

dialogues.speaker: BASSIST
dialogues.text: Last week we rehearsed without drums. You’re the only drummer we've ever had. Beat. He walks off. Andrew stands there. Confused...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 97
dialogues.text: INT. ANDREW’S APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - HOURS LATER 98 Andrew enters. Eyes his drums. Then -- he has a thought.  Pink (9/10/2013) 91A He pulls out his phone. Hesitates. Nervous -- but excited He dials. We hear ringing, he feels his heart thumping, h to himself, starts walking forward, breathes in, and then after a few seconds --  Pink (9/10/2013) 92

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: (pacing, stomach clenching, it’s been so long--) Hey... It’s...it’s Andrew. Silence on the other end. Then--

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: I -- I just figured I'd call -- it’s been forever, and I... I’m really sorry about how I... I’m just so sorry... How I acted... You know... (a beat; she doesn’t respond; he sits down, trying to get the words out--) And I -- I didn’t know if you knew -- I’m playing JVC this weekend... Maybe you’d like to come? We could grab pizza afterward and complain about our schools again... He chuckles. Then waits. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jv?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Uh -- no, Jvc. It’s a jazz festival.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. Another beat. Then--

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: When is it?

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: It’s next Friday.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ok... I don't know, I'll check with my boyfriend. Beat. WE CUT to a CLOSE-UP of Andrew as he takes this in. can tell -- the word hits him hard.  Pink (9/10/2013) 93

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: ---Got it. (silence; then--) Well... Cool. Maybe I’1l see you there.

dialogues.speaker: NICOLE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'1l check. I don't think he likes jazz though. I'll check.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Cool... Thanks. Nicole hangs up. You can see it in Andrew’s eyes -- real disappointment. Real hurt. And surprise at how hurt he fe He eyes his drums again. Sits down at them -- -- and STARTS PRACTICING LIKE MAD. Pouring his anger, his into his playing. The SOUNDS of FURIOUS DRUMMING build, continuing through following--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew sliding into his slacks. Buttons his white button- down. Slides on his black jacket. Ties his tie...  101 102

dialogues.speaker: 102A
dialogues.text: 103 104 Pink (9/10/2013) 94 INT. FLETCHER’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - DAY 101 Fletcher slipping into his own suit. Elegant, fastidious. like an old-school bandleader. But there’s something mela about the sight of him -- going through his pre-concert r all alone... He straightens his tie. De-lints the suit. He’s tidy, iib careful. He passes by his piano, pauses to play a melody the keys. Grabs his music folder and heads to the door...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 102
dialogues.text: INT. ANDREW’S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - DAY 102A Andrew clips his nails, applies ointment to his hands, th wraps each finger in a Band-Aid. EXT. NEW YORK STREET - FLETCHER’S SUBWAY ENTRANCE - 103

dialogues.speaker: EVENING
dialogues.text: Fletcher ignoring several passing CABS, enters a SUBWAY STATION...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew emerging from a SUBWAY STATION. Murmuring to himse tapping on his knees. The clock’s ticking... He checks his phone, picks up speed, almost breaks into a The DRUMMING BUILDS, he goes FASTER and FASTER, until, finally -- -- as the DRUMMING CUTS OUT -- -- he comes to a sudden stop. He’s standing right in front of CARNEGIE HALL. A giant ba hangs above the main steps: “JVC IN NYC: JAZZ!" And, keep out of sight -- -- Fletcher. Strolling up the side-steps around the corne hidden from the crowd. Andrew sees him. Follows.  105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scene is more or less what we saw before Studio Band competitions -- only taken to eleven. A rush of MUSICIANS STAGE HANDS and TECHNICIANS backstage, a swell of TUNING TRUMPETERS, TROMBONISTS and SAXOPHONISTS join in. Andrew stands back. Checks his phone. 7:28. It’s almost time. He gazes around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew peers out through a door, catching a glimpse of th MAIN HALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew sees the AUDIENCE milling. Sees a face he recogniz the crowd, small in the distance. JIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew smiles at the sight. Feeling confident, ready to p himself at last. He walks back down the stairs toward the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew and the Studio Band listen to Fletcher's speech.

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Alright, gang, listen up! 15 seconds to get into places. For those of you who are new to this, it’s very simple: do well tonight, and the world will open up for you. The folks out there, they make a phone call and you’re a Lincoln Center core. Or a Blue Note signee. Or an EMC client. Drop the ball, and I'd suggest switching careers -- because the other thing about those cats is they never forget. Andrew takes this in. Beat. A STAGE HAND appears, waves. FLETCHER (CONT’D) On that note -- break a leg. The PLAYERS proceed on-stage. Andrew takes a deep breath, tries to keep his cool, and, counting in his head, walks forward --  106 Pink (9/10/2013) 96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stage is decked in blue lights. The instruments gleam Beyond it, a yawning expanse of black. The audience... An hush, an undercurrent of murmurs and whispers gathering steam, as each PLAYER takes to the stage, one by one... Then -- APPLAUSE. 1200 people’s worth of applause. Fletch appears, taking his spot, smiling. The applause swells up And then -- Fletcher turns around to face Andrew. He star at_him for what seems like a full minute. Comes up to him making as though helping him position a microphone over t drum kit, and, leaning in, quietly, discreetly, menacingl

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: It was you. The lights shift. Blue to bright, harsh, near-blinding ye It's showtime. Andrew is completely still.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: ...Was...was me what...?

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: (then, leaning in even closer,) Why do you think I invited you here? I’ve known it was you all along. Beat. He lets it sink in. Retreats to his spot, smiling a Andrew. Then, off Andrew’s paralyzed stare, he turns to t audience. They APPLAUD. A few seconds later...silence. Th FLETCHER (CONT’D) Good evening, ladies and gentlemen. We’re going to start things off with an old favorite of mine. Andrew, his heart in his throat, looks at his sheet music “WHIPLASH”. Holds his sticks tight, but his hands are now slippery with sweat... Fletcher waits. More silence... FLETCHER (CONT’D) It’s called “Upswingin’”. ON ANDREW. What? Andrew turns to his left and catches a glimpse of the SAXOPHONISTS’ sheet music. Written on the top: “UPSWINGIN turns right, sees the BASSIST’s music. Ditto. He looks ah And there's Fletcher -- staring right back at him. And sm  Pink (9/10/2013) 97 Andrew turns around. Has to stop this. Can’t ruin it for other PLAYERS -- but Fletcher has already raised his hand the cue. Andrew rises from his seat -- when the BASSIST glares at him: What are you doing? And just then -- withi that same split-second -- -- Fletcher’s index finger bends down. The cue. The BAND EXPLODES into UPSWINGIN’. Horns blasting, saxes wailing -- fast, furious, half-Latin and half-swing. Andr doesn’t even play at first -- doesn’t want to destroy thi glares quickly follow, and he has no choice... He plays. Trains his ears to try to stay on target... But time signature is impossible to get a firm grip on... He misses a fill... Then the time signature changes... He ca keep up... Then the band gives way to rubato piano... He late... Then the band surges back in... He comes in late. He’s driving completely blind.

dialogues.speaker: BASSIST
dialogues.text: (clenched teeth to Andrew) The fuck?! Come on... Andrew, desperate, tries to fix things -- but he can’t. Sliding further and further behind. PLAYERS eying him. Yo can almost hear MURMURS in the audience, rising in volume And, through it all, Fletcher seems serene. Andrew misses yet another break, and-- BASSIST (CONT’D) Are you fucking kidding me? This hits Andrew like a knife. Tears well up in his eyes. performance is already so far beyond saving... Another missed hit. More MURMURS in the audience, louder louder now, as the number veers, swerves, and sloppily staggers to its close... A swell of horns, a misplaced cr of cymbals, what seems like a fermata... Andrew stops -- as the band RESUMES. And just as Andrew resumes -- the ba STOPS. Andrew's playing alone. He quickly moves to silence his drums. The chart is done. And now -- the deafening silence. No applause. Just the sound softly rippling and settling Andrew's last cymbal hit...  107 Pink (9/10/2013) 98 Andrew sits at his set, in tears. Fletcher stays still. L at Andrew. On Fletcher's face, the look of a victor... As turns back to the audience we hear... +..a smattering of polite, muted applause trickling throughout the theater. Quiet, half-hearted, pitiful. No one here has ever seen a disaster quite like that befo

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: We see Jim, standing in the very back, by the doors... Mortified, heading for the hall...

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Fletcher sashays back to the drum set. To Andrew, with a

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: I guess you don’t have it. Andrew is still in his seat. Tears stinging his cheeks...

dialogues.speaker: BASSIST
dialogues.text: Didn't you get the fucking chart? Andrew looks at the Bassist. Realizes what Fletcher did.. the other MUSICIANS glaring at him, infuriated...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Andrew feels the AUDIENCE staring at him -- can almost ma their faces as the stage lights begin to DIM... Seated in one of the front rows -- is NICOLE. We see that to her, holding her hand, is a YOUNG MAN...

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Feeling CRUSHED, HUMILIATED, NAUSEATED, Andrew staggers u ...-and RETREATS to the back of the stage. Out of the aud view -- about to leave this all behind once and for all..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim running... Down the hall... Toward the entrance to backstage...  108 Pink (9/10/2013) 99

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Andrew... Retreating BACKSTAGE... .-.-when he sees -- around the corner of the backstage en -- his father.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WINGS
dialogues.text: Jim has just arrived at the entryway. Looks at Andrew. Hu toward him. Is going to put an end to this. Andrew looks his dad for a moment, approaching. Jim reaches him -- -- and HUGS him.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: I love you. I’m so sorry this is happening to you. Andrew looks at his dad. Something seems to click inside that instant. He pulls back. The desperation in his eyes giving way to something else. Jim watches Andrew as Andrew steps backwa before... +..a pair of STAGE HANDS arrive.

dialogues.speaker: STAGE HAND
dialogues.text: Sir, you can’t be here--

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: Yes I can, I’m taking him with me--

dialogues.speaker: STAGE HAND
dialogues.text: (to Andrew) You know each other? Andrew is silent for a moment. Still. As though it has ju dawned on him. He takes in the sight -- his dad, dwarfed by the Stage Ha reaching out to him. Jim has never looked quite so small son, quite so pathetic, as at this moment. A beat. More silence. And then --

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No. Jim goes wide-eyed. Utterly shocked. Andrew steps further back, as the STAGE HANDS move to pull Jim away--  Pink (9/10/2013) 100

dialogues.speaker: STAGE HAND
dialogues.text: Alright, sir, that’s enough--

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: My -- my son -- I need to get my son--

dialogues.speaker: STAGE HAND
dialogues.text: Let’s calm down--

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: (frantic now--) Andrew! ! Andrew calmly turns his back to his father and coldly hea the stage.

dialogues.speaker: JIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Andrew! !

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Andrew grabs new sticks, makes as though he was just swit pairs and never leaving, and, ignoring his father’s calls behind -- trains his eyes back on Fletcher. Fletcher looks at Andrew. Seems pleased: This will be fun But Andrew doesn’t look scared anymore. Instead, his eyes glassy, hollowed out -- and hungry... There’s a rage in t that we haven’t seen before... This will not be the end..

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: (to the audience) Thank you... For our final number we’re bringing it back to Ellington. This is “Caravan”. But then, before Fletcher can even turn back around -- le cue the band -- Andrew launches into a double-time Latin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone, his stick beating away at the ride cymbal, setting tempo for the rest of the band. Everyone looks at him. Wh the fuck...? He has started on his own, before any cue, beating the drums as though vengefully. Fletcher glares at him. Who the fuck do you think you are Andrew just keeps playing. Knows exactly what he’s doing not about to be stopped. Building in his eyes -- that sam coiled rage... To the BASSIST--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: Follow me on four.  Pink (9/10/2013) 101 The BASSIST has no choice. Andrew nods in time as a count and the BASSIST joins in. Now we’ve got the bass and drum playing, laying out the beat. Andrew looks back at Fletch Drills into him with his eyes -- the kind of look Fletche often given him. And, subtly, so that only Fletcher can s Andrew mouths out two words:

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fuck. You. It hits Fletcher. Realizing he too has no choice, Fletche the rest of the band. Raises his hands, re-assuming contr or trying to make as though he has control -- and cues th The BAND begins CARAVAN PLUS DRUM SOLO CARNEGIE HALL, pla opening patterns, Andrew matching them beat for beat. Fletcher then edges toward Andrew. His back turned to the audience, only Andrew can see his face, he leans in and--

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: I will gouge out your eyes you motherfucker. --but Andrew promptly DROWNS HIM OUT with a crash cymbal Another “fuck you”. Fletcher’s words only seem to strengt The band roars into overdrive, the brass blasting away, A giving everything he’s got. Fletcher steps back. Andrew j keeps looking straight ahead at him. Unafraid now. A mach SOLOS begin... TROMBONE is up first... WE MOVE IN CLOSE t Andrew... He looks at his right arm... It’s still going.. himself seems surprised. He takes a chance -- plays a tri fill. Nails it. Goes again -- the off-beat hi-hat accent tripped him up in his first Studio Band rehearsal. Nails The audience is silent... No murmurs this time... Back to Andrew... WE DRIFT DOWN TO HIS FEET... His right foot fea the bass drum so fast all we can see is a blur... WE DRIFT BACK UP... His left hand... Notes popping on the snare, the toms... Both his arms battered but utterly determined, as though with minds of their own... He breat breathes, beating against his fears, his doubts... He’s in control, pouring himself into his drums -- and it sight to behold. Like a master dancer, movements so fast precise, brash yet elegant... Violent, frenetic playing, there’s something gorgeous about it... WE DRIFT TO FLETCHER... Still glaring at Andrew -- but hi face now says one thing and one thing only: This is playi he has never seen before.  Pink (9/10/2013) 102 The brass starts giving way to drum breaks... And Andrew makes of each break a stunner... His double-stroke rolls roaring across the toms, his feet and legs switching rhyt meters, tempos, then careening back into place... All lim moving in a sustained frenzy, sweat splashing, mouth open eyes blazing, the whole set vibrating, then shaking, look like it’s about to explode... Fletcher turns an inch toward the AUDIENCE... Sees them transfixed...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE LOBBY DOORS
dialogues.text: ...dim watches through the opened lobby doors...

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: The number is at a peak... And Fletcher, like so many, is just watching Andrew... The band nears the coda... The melody, the rat-a-tat-tat patterns, the squealing horns a growling saxes... The drums pushing it all forward... Fletcher almost smiles. Was this his plan all along...? He moves his arms, conducting again... The band reaches t final bar... The final note... He raises his hands... Sus the note. Swings his arm down... A BLAST of horns. And th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: band is finished. Except, that is, for the drums. Andrew’s still playing, launching into an extended solo... Fletcher looks at him. Confused now. Goes up to the drums FLETCHER (CONT’D) Andrew -- Andrew--

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: (over his playing) I’‘1l cue the band... Wait for my cue... There’s nothing more Fletcher can do. Andrew's playing gr louder, more involved, all four limbs joining in, the sou growing bigger and bigger... He has effectively taken ove the stage -- and all the other PLAYERS can do is watch... is the bandleader. Andrew looks ahead... Past Fletcher... To the darkness... the audience... He leans forward, closes his eyes, dives Sticks whirling, arms and legs belting and hammering, his head bobbing up and down, his back arched... Keeps the rudiments going on his left hand... Adds one ingredient, another... Then a third, then a fourth...  Pink (9/10/2013) 103 Keeps adding and building and piling on, beyond anything ever attempted... Going absolutely batshit-insane on the sweat flying, hands blurring, drums trembling...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE LOBBY DOORS
dialogues.text: Jim watches Andrew -- crazed, exhausted, looks like he’s pushing himself past what is safe -- and knows there is no longer anything he can do about it. He has lost. And then -- one of the USHERS steps forward from the edge of the stage. He looks at Jim -- and closes the doors, blocking Jim’s view. We linger on Jim for a moment -- behind the closed door, silence.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Back to Andrew -- at the height of intensity... Keeps his eyes closed... Feeling his way through this... Shooting b into the double-time... But trying to go even faster than before... Not 330... Not even 400... Trying, trying, tryi to reach that mythical place, the place where only the gr live... 410... 420... Even 430... Fletcher stands still... His eyes widening... He’s no lon calculating... Not even thinking... He’s just awed. Murmurs throughout the AUDIENCE... Audible, even over the roar of the drum set... They can’t believe it... 435 now... 440... 443... Which means those sticks are moving faster than a tennis shot across a court... Faster than Andrew has ever moved. Faster...faster...and, finally... ---450. Andrew OPENS HIS EYES... He’s in disbelief. The stage is He owns it. He breaks back into snare-based patterns, rol around the toms, the cymbals... Fletcher is floored. Turns, sees something extraordinary there, just visible in the darkness of the theater...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: AUDIENCE MEMBERS turning to each other... A line-up of su and-tie spectators whipping out phones or pads...  Pink (9/10/2013) 104 MANAGERS, JOURNALISTS, A&R EXECS, BANDLEADERS... A few hurrying out, as though in a mad rush, making frantic cal More people peering INTO THE THEATER through glass doors.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: We TURN BACK to Andrew -- his ears start RINGING... The N grows with each hit, drowning out all the other noises... Andrew clenches his jaw, closes his eyes again, keeps playing, tries to ignore it... Plays harder, louder, poun away... Andrew's kick drum starts to slide from the power of his playing... His sheet music falls off its stand... His crash cymbal almost falls over -- but a HAND reaches in to steady it. It’s Fletcher. Leaning over the drum set now -- and, for almost the first time on-stage, not cursing or snarling a Andrew, but instead--

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER
dialogues.text: Take it back to the snare... Andrew considers this. It’s a good idea. He moves back to snare... FLETCHER (CONT’D) Slow... (Andrew does as suggested) Single-stroke... Andrew nods again... Slowly simmers the beat down... Lets hi-hat hang open for a moment... Everything goes quiet... Silence for a second... You can feel the hush, the anticipation, that indescribable electricity in the air.. Fletcher looks at Andrew, looks at his sticks, face brimm with hope now... Andrew begins a series of slow, clean sn hits... Right stroke, left stroke, right, left... FLETCHER (CONT’D) Up... Up... Andrew nods... Ever so gradually builds up the pace... Ri left, right, left... Builds up the pace some more... Righ left, right, left... Keeps going... Speeds up more, a hai a time... Right, left... Speeds up more.. Right, left... Fletcher stands there, nodding, focused, like a coach at critical moment. Waves his hand, pushing Andrew on...  Pink (9/10/2013) 105 Andrew builds the tempo more, right, left, right, left, t strokes blurring into each other, the whole thing soundin like the fire of a machine gun, like what we heard in the beginning... Right-left-right-left-right-left... And, before we know it, we can no longer make out the individual strokes. They’re so fast that all we can hear single SOUND, sustained and growing in volume...

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on... Come on... Andrew, goaded on, builds the volume. His single-stroke r swelling, taking over the entire theater...

dialogues.speaker: FLETCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come _on...!! Come on!!! Andrew builds it further... Going beyond what even he’d planned for himself -- his arms like machines, the single stroke roll building steam and power and pinning the audi in their seats... Fletcher raising his hands, beckoning Andrew forward... He and the drummer working together, pl and conductor, competitor and coach... Andrew moves to the toms, then back to the snare, then ba The bass drum and hi-hat next, every part of the set join every limb, every component, everything building up, up, It’s unlike anything we’ve ever seen... Andrew tearing a through the stage, his heartbeat racing, the sweat pourin him like a waterfall, blood gushing from his hands and st the cymbals and drum-heads... Everything a BLUR... Then -- a BLAST OF SEPARATED SNARE HITS -- and then -- An CHOKES the crash cymbal. A second of pure silence. Fletcher looks at Andrew. Andrew looks at Fletcher. And t Fletcher turns to the band, raises his hand... ...and CUES THE FINAL NOTE. The whole band roars it out, horns hitting their highest and Andrew rolling around his drum set like a madman, cym and snare and toms and the entire apparatus about to burs WE DIVE IN CLOSE TO HIM, his instrument, his sticks, his all sweat and eyes about to pop, the next Buddy Rich, the Charlie Parker -- Fletcher's only Charlie Parker -- decki the stage with a climactic crash of cymbals right as, on very last hit of hits, we-- SMASH CUT TO BLACK.
